sections.heading: What is Causative-Passive?
sections.content:
Causative-passive (使役受身) expresses being made to do something . It combines causative (make do) with passive (be done to).

食べさせられる (tabesaserareru) - be made to eat 書かせられる (kakaserareru) - be made to write させられる (saserareru) - be made to do

sections.heading: The Suffering Form
sections.content:
Causative-passive emphasizes being forced to do something against your will:

宿題をさせられた "I was made to do homework" (I didn't want to) 待たせられた "I was made to wait" (I suffered)

children.heading: Method: Causative + Passive
children.content: Step 1: Make causative form Step 2: Apply passive conjugation

children.heading: Ichidan Verbs
children.content:
食べる → 食べさせる → 食べさせられる 見る → 見させる → 見させられる 寝る → 寝させる → 寝させられる

Pattern: -ru → -saserareru

children.heading: Godan Verbs (Long Form)
children.content:
書く → 書かせる → 書かせられる 読む → 読ませる → 読ませられる 話す → 話させる → 話させられる

Pattern: -u → -aserareru

children.heading: Godan Verbs (Short Form)
children.content:
More common in speech:

書く → 書かされる (kakasareru) 読む → 読まされる (yomasareru) 話す → 話さされる (hanasasareru) 買う → 買わされる (kawasareru)

Pattern: -u → -asareru (shorter!)

children.heading: Irregular Verbs
children.content: する → させられる (be made to do) 来る → 来させられる / 来さされる (be made to come)

sections.heading: Complete Conjugation Chart
sections.content:
| Dictionary | Causative | Causative-Passive (Long) | Short Form | | ---------- | ---------- | ------------------------ | ------------ | | 書く | 書かせる | 書かせられる | 書かされる ✓ | | 読む | 読ませる | 読ませられる | 読まされる ✓ | | 話す | 話させる | 話させられる | 話さされる ✓ | | 食べる | 食べさせる | 食べさせられる | (no short) | | 見る | 見させる | 見させられる | (no short) | | する | させる | させられる | (no short) |

Important: Short form only for Godan verbs!

children.heading: 1. Forced to Do Something
children.content: 残業させられた "I was made to work overtime" 宿題をさせられた "I was made to do homework" 謝らせられた "I was made to apologize"

children.heading: 2. Against Your Will
children.content: 嫌いな食べ物を食べさせられた "I was made to eat food I hate" 行きたくないパーティーに行かせられた "I was made to go to a party I didn't want to go to"

children.heading: 3. Suffering/Complaint
children.content: 3時間も待たせられた "I was made to wait for 3 whole hours!" 毎日掃除させられる "I'm made to clean every day"

sections.heading: Particle Usage
sections.content:
Person forced is marked by は/が:

私は母に部屋を掃除させられた "I was made by my mother to clean my room" 学生は先生に本を読ませられた "Students were made by the teacher to read books"

Person forcing is marked by に:

上司に残業させられた "I was made to work overtime by my boss" 親に勉強させられた "I was made to study by my parents"

children.heading: School/Work
children.content: 宿題をさせられる "be made to do homework" レポートを書かされる "be made to write a report" 残業させられる "be made to work overtime" 発表させられる "be made to present" 掃除させられる "be made to clean"

children.heading: Childhood
children.content: 野菜を食べさせられた "I was made to eat vegetables" ピアノを習わされた "I was made to learn piano" 早く寝かせられた "I was made to sleep early"

children.heading: Waiting
children.content: 待たされる / 待たせられる "be made to wait" Example: 2時間も待たされた "I was made to wait for 2 hours!"

sections.heading: Polite Forms
sections.content: 食べさせられる → 食べさせられます (polite) 書かされる → 書かされます (polite) させられる → させられます (polite)

children.heading: Negative
children.content: 食べさせられない (not made to eat) 書かされない (not made to write) させられない (not made to do)

children.heading: Past
children.content: 食べさせられた (was made to eat) 書かされた (was made to write) させられた (was made to do)

sections.heading: Long vs Short Form
sections.content:
| Long Form | Short Form | Usage | | -------------- | ------------ | ------------------ | | 書かせられる | 書かされる ✓ | Short more common | | 読ませられる | 読まされる ✓ | Short more common | | 待たせられる | 待たされる ✓ | Both common | | 食べさせられる | — | Ichidan: long only |

Short form preferred in conversation!

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using Short Form with Ichidan
children.content: Wrong: 食べさされる ❌ Right: 食べさせられる ✓ Wrong: 見さされる ❌ Right: 見させられる ✓

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong Particle
children.content: Wrong: 母を掃除させられた ❌ Right: 母に掃除させられた ✓ "I was made by mother to clean"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing with Simple Passive
children.content: 食べられる - "be eaten" (passive) 食べさせられる - "be made to eat" (causative-passive) 叱られる - "be scolded" (passive) 叱らされる - "be made to scold" (causative-passive)

children.heading: Mistake 4: Unnecessary Causative-Passive
children.content:
Unnatural: 行かされた Better: 行った / 行かなければならなかった "I went / I had to go"

Use only when emphasizing being forced!

children.heading: Example 1: Complaining About Work
children.content: A: 最近仕事どう？ "How's work lately?" B: 大変。毎日残業させられてる "Tough. I'm made to work overtime every day" A: それはきついね "That's rough" B: 本当に。早く帰りたい "Really. I want to go home early"

children.heading: Example 2: Childhood Memories
children.content: A: 子供の時、何させられた？ "What were you made to do as a child?" B: ピアノを習わされた "I was made to learn piano" A: 好きだった？ "Did you like it?" B: 全然。嫌いだった "Not at all. I hated it"

children.heading: Example 3: School Life
children.content: A: 昨日なんで遅かったの？ "Why were you late yesterday?" B: 先生に掃除させられた "I was made to clean by the teacher" A: 何で？ "Why?" B: 宿題を忘れたから "Because I forgot my homework"

sections.heading: Emphasis on Suffering
sections.content:
Causative-passive often implies complaint:

3時間も待たされた！ "I was made to wait for 3 whole hours!" 毎日同じことをさせられる "I'm made to do the same thing every day" 嫌なことばかりやらされる "I'm only made to do things I hate"

sections.heading: With も (emphasis)
sections.content: 5回も書き直しさせられた "I was made to rewrite it 5 times!" 10ページも読まされた "I was made to read 10 whole pages!"

children.heading: Workplace
children.content: 上司に無理なスケジュールをやらされる "I'm made to do an unreasonable schedule by my boss" 休日出勤させられた "I was made to come to work on a holiday"

children.heading: School
children.content: 先生に作文を書かされた "I was made to write an essay by the teacher" みんなの前で発表させられた "I was made to present in front of everyone"

children.heading: Home
children.content: 親に部屋を掃除させられる "I'm made to clean my room by my parents" 弟の世話をさせられる "I'm made to take care of my little brother"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Causative-passive = being made to do ✓ Godan short: -u → -asareru (common) ✓ Godan long: -u → -aserareru ✓ Ichidan: -ru → -saserareru (no short) ✓ Emphasizes being forced ✓ Often implies complaint/suffering ✓ Person forced uses は/が ✓ Person forcing uses に ✓ Short form preferred in speech

Master causative-passive - express being forced naturally!
